organization.$: Department of Computer and Information Science

head.citation-title: Quaternionic local ranking binary pattern: A local descriptor of color images
head.abstracts: Â© 2015 IEEE.This paper proposes a local descriptor called quaternionic local ranking binary pattern (QLRBP) for color images. Different from traditional descriptors that are extracted from each color channel separately or from vector representations, QLRBP works on the quaternionic representation (QR) of the color image that encodes a color pixel using a quaternion. QLRBP is able to handle all color channels directly in the quaternionic domain and include their relations simultaneously. Applying a Clifford translation to QR of the color image, QLRBP uses a reference quaternion to rank QRs of two color pixels, and performs a local binary coding on the phase of the transformed result to generate local descriptors of the color image. Experiments demonstrate that the QLRBP outperforms several state-of-the-art methods.

organization.$: Department of Computer and Information Science

publisher.publishername: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.

grant-text.$: This work was supported in part by the Research Committee at the University of Macau under Grant MRG001/ZYC/2013/FST, Grant MRG017/ZYC/2014/FST, Grant MYRG113(Y1-L3)-FST12-ZYC, and Grant MYRG2014-00003-FST and in part by the Macau Science and Technology Development Fund under Grant FDCT/106/2013/A3.

coredata.dc:description: This paper proposes a local descriptor called quaternionic local ranking binary pattern (QLRBP) for color images. Different from traditional descriptors that are extracted from each color channel separately or from vector representations, QLRBP works on the quaternionic representation (QR) of the color image that encodes a color pixel using a quaternion. QLRBP is able to handle all color channels directly in the quaternionic domain and include their relations simultaneously. Applying a Clifford translation to QR of the color image, QLRBP uses a reference quaternion to rank QRs of two color pixels, and performs a local binary coding on the phase of the transformed result to generate local descriptors of the color image. Experiments demonstrate that the QLRBP outperforms several state-of-the-art methods.
coredata.dc:title: Quaternionic local ranking binary pattern: A local descriptor of color images
coredata.dc:publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.
